speaker: Duncan
text: What bloody man is that? He can report,

speaker: Duncan
text: As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt

speaker: Duncan
text: The newest state.

speaker: Duncan
text: O valiant cousin, worthy gentleman!

speaker: Duncan
text: Dismayed not this our captains, Macbeth and

speaker: Duncan
text: Banquo?

speaker: Duncan
text: So well thy words become thee as thy wounds:

speaker: Duncan
text: They smack of honor both.—Go, get him surgeons.

speaker: Duncan
text: Who comes here?

speaker: Duncan
text: Whence cam’st thou, worthy thane?

speaker: Duncan
text: Great happiness!

speaker: Duncan
text: No more that Thane of Cawdor shall deceive

speaker: Duncan
text: Our bosom interest. Go, pronounce his present

speaker: Duncan
text: death,

speaker: Duncan
text: And with his former title greet Macbeth.

speaker: Duncan
text: What he hath lost, noble Macbeth hath won.

speaker: Duncan
text: Is execution done on Cawdor? Are not

speaker: Duncan
text: Those in commission yet returned?

speaker: Duncan
text: There’s no art

speaker: Duncan
text: To find the mind’s construction in the face.

speaker: Duncan
text: He was a gentleman on whom I built

speaker: Duncan
text: An absolute trust.

speaker: Duncan
text: O worthiest cousin,

speaker: Duncan
text: The sin of my ingratitude even now

speaker: Duncan
text: Was heavy on me. Thou art so far before

speaker: Duncan
text: That swiftest wing of recompense is slow

speaker: Duncan
text: To overtake thee. Would thou hadst less deserved,

speaker: Duncan
text: That the proportion both of thanks and payment

speaker: Duncan
text: Might have been mine! Only I have left to say,

speaker: Duncan
text: More is thy due than more than all can pay.

speaker: Duncan
text: Welcome hither.

speaker: Duncan
text: I have begun to plant thee and will labor

speaker: Duncan
text: To make thee full of growing.—Noble Banquo,

speaker: Duncan
text: That hast no less deserved nor must be known

speaker: Duncan
text: No less to have done so, let me enfold thee

speaker: Duncan
text: And hold thee to my heart.

speaker: Duncan
text: My plenteous joys,

speaker: Duncan
text: Wanton in fullness, seek to hide themselves

speaker: Duncan
text: In drops of sorrow.—Sons, kinsmen, thanes,

speaker: Duncan
text: And you whose places are the nearest, know

speaker: Duncan
text: We will establish our estate upon

speaker: Duncan
text: Our eldest, Malcolm, whom we name hereafter

speaker: Duncan
text: The Prince of Cumberland; which honor must

speaker: Duncan
text: Not unaccompanied invest him only,

speaker: Duncan
text: But signs of nobleness, like stars, shall shine

speaker: Duncan
text: On all deservers.—From hence to Inverness

speaker: Duncan
text: And bind us further to you.

speaker: Duncan
text: My worthy Cawdor.

speaker: Duncan
text: True, worthy Banquo. He is full so valiant,

speaker: Duncan
text: And in his commendations I am fed:

speaker: Duncan
text: It is a banquet to me.—Let’s after him,

speaker: Duncan
text: Whose care is gone before to bid us welcome.

speaker: Duncan
text: It is a peerless kinsman.

speaker: Duncan
text: This castle hath a pleasant seat. The air

speaker: Duncan
text: Nimbly and sweetly recommends itself

speaker: Duncan
text: Unto our gentle senses.

speaker: Duncan
text: See, see our honored hostess!—

speaker: Duncan
text: The love that follows us sometime is our trouble,

speaker: Duncan
text: Which still we thank as love. Herein I teach you

speaker: Duncan
text: How you shall bid God ’ild us for your pains

speaker: Duncan
text: And thank us for your trouble.

speaker: Duncan
text: Where’s the Thane of Cawdor?

speaker: Duncan
text: We coursed him at the heels and had a purpose

speaker: Duncan
text: To be his purveyor; but he rides well,

speaker: Duncan
text: And his great love, sharp as his spur, hath helped

speaker: Duncan
text: him

speaker: Duncan
text: To his home before us. Fair and noble hostess,

speaker: Duncan
text: We are your guest tonight.

speaker: Duncan
text: Give me your hand.

speaker: Duncan
text: Conduct me to mine host. We love him highly

speaker: Duncan
text: And shall continue our graces towards him.

speaker: Duncan
text: By your leave, hostess.
